alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 18 at 12:16PM PDT until September 18 at 1:45PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Dust Advisory for... South central Lincoln County in eastern Washington... * Until 145 PM PDT. * At 1209 PM PDT, a dust channel was 16 miles north of Ritzville, or 41 miles northeast of Moses Lake, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes State Route 28 in Washington between Odessa and Harrington. Locations impacted include... Odessa, Lamona, and Mohler. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
